support_summary: ATXN3 interacts with X-ray repair cross-complementing protein 1 (XRCC1), a scaffold protein in the base excision repair pathway, facilitating DNA damage repair.

functions.cellular_process: ATXN3 interacts with X-ray repair cross-complementing protein 1 (XRCC1), a crucial scaffold protein in the base excision repair (BER) pathway that repairs DNA damage from oxidation and alkylation.
functions.effect_description: This interaction likely facilitates the assembly or stability of the BER protein complex at sites of DNA damage, thereby promoting the efficient repair of single-strand breaks and modified bases.
biological_consequence: ATXN3 interacts with XRCC1 → BER complex is stabilized or recruited → DNA damage repair is facilitated

mechanism: ATXN3 interacts with X-ray repair cross-complementing protein 1 (XRCC1), a crucial scaffold protein in the base excision repair (BER) pathway that repairs DNA damage from oxidation and alkylation.
effect: This interaction likely facilitates the assembly or stability of the BER protein complex at sites of DNA damage, thereby promoting the efficient repair of single-strand breaks and modified bases.
summary: ATXN3 activates XRCC1 to modulate base excision repair, ultimately affecting dna damage repair is facilitated.
